meanings.definition: Engaged in an activity for pay, but not as a full-time occupation.
meanings.sent1: The team consisted of semiprofessional players who balanced their sport with other jobs.
meanings.sent2: She worked as a semiprofessional photographer on weekends while studying during the week.
meanings.sent3: The semiprofessional chef accidentally added salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: His semiprofessional approach to gardening turned his backyard into a colorful paradise.
meanings.sent5: The semiprofessional musician's passion for music shone through every performance.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in an activity for pay, but not as a full-time occupation.
meanings.sent1: The semiprofessional joined the local band to earn extra money while pursuing other interests.
meanings.sent2: As a semiprofessional in the art world, she sold her paintings at weekend markets.
meanings.sent3: The semiprofessional juggler entertained the crowd with unexpected tricks and jokes.
meanings.sent4: Being a semiprofessional writer, he balanced his creative work with a part-time job.
meanings.sent5: The semiprofessional athlete's dedication to training paid off during the competition.
